page.title: 08ECOLOGY OF SEAFORD
page.content: { SEAFORD}IS A{COASTAL TOWN}IT IS SURROUNDED BY{DOWNLAND COUNTRYSIDE. MOST OF THE TOWN IS BUILT ON{CHALK}AND {SHINGLE.}IT IS DIFFICULT TO BUILD HOUSES ON THE SHINGLE WHERE THE{RIVER {OUSE}USED TO BE. THE DOWNLANDS NEAR OUR COAST HAVE VERY FEW TREES BUT MANY{SHRUBS INCLUDING HAWTHORN, ELDER, PRIVET, BLACKTHORN, ROSE AND CLEMATIS. OWING TO THE{EXPOSED CONDITIONS}ON THE CLIFF TOPS,{PLANTS}ARE OFTEN MUCH {SMALLER}THAN NORMAL.THERE ARE MANY INTERESTING GROUND FLORA,INCLUDING {RARE ORCHIDS. { HERRING GULLS}ARE AMONGST THE MOST COMMON BIRDS AND MANY OTHER SPECIES NEST IN THE AREA. THERE ARE{BADGERS IN THE RESERVE WHICH OFTEN ENTER THE GARDENS OF LOCAL RESIDENTS.THE{FOX}IS QUITE COMMON, WHILST{RABBITS}HAVE RE-APPEARED IN LARGE NUMBERS.
